comment: Orange zest. Flowers freshness of light fruits. Palate oily  lightly alcohol burn mid palate rose fresh fruits ,soft oaky interesting bourbon not like bourbon that you used to have .

Oaky, sweet, smooth, and soft. This is the bourbon you are looking for on a cold winter's night, or to celebrate a special occasion. Watch out scotch, bourbon ages just as well, and it certainly brings out the best qualities in this one!
I haven't had any orphan barrel that are impressive.

An interesting bourbon. The nose is sweet leather with a floral quality to it, but the whiskey is spicy, pepper, clove and an almost astringent tinge to it on the palate. Still it had a smooth mouthfeel and a light lingering finish. I personally didn't feel these factors played well together, though it is a unique offering that I can't compare to any other bourbon I've tried. Worth a dram, but I wouldn't find much use for an entire bottle.

Old leather and wood on the nose. That nose transfers straight into the front of the taste with big leathery notes that glide into a hot allspice and vanilla swell followed by a smooth but slightly tannic dark chocolate. Beautiful and well balanced bourbon. A personal favorite.
Dominican cigar smoke, new leather interior, and three twists on the cracked pepper grinder. You'll be reflecting on the "good ol' days" by the second swig.
By far my favorite Bourbon.  Costs a bunch but amazing

Like it, but little oaky.
Rating: 4.0
Not easy to find but worth the effort. Sophisticated profile. Well balanced. Dangerously easy to drink.

Best whiskey I've had, did blind tastings of 25+ whiskies over the course of a few weeks and this emerged as the winner.  A little smoke, leather and musty for the age and some baking spice on the palate, I could drink just this from now on.
Oceanic salty, medium spice, sipping whiskey
so smooth never had one this old. still tons of flavor
Light on the nose, very smooth with zero burn.
Rich but not heavy, complex but easy to drink. Really nice!
